description.zh-cn: 1868年至1947年间日本的国号，为第二次世界大战轴心国之一，于1945年8月15日宣布无条件投降。
description.en: The official name of Japan from 1868 to 1947, a member of the Axis powers during World War II, which announced its unconditional surrender on August 15, 1945.

description.zh-cn: 第二次世界大战同盟国主要成员，对日本使用原子弹并主导了战后的占领。
description.en: A principal member of the Allied powers in World War II, which used atomic bombs against Japan and led the subsequent occupation.

description.zh-cn: 第二次世界大战同盟国主要成员，与美国和中国共同发表了《波茨坦宣言》。
description.en: A principal member of the Allied powers in World War II, which co-issued the Potsdam Declaration with the United States and China.

description.zh-cn: 第二次世界大战同盟国主要成员，与美国和英国共同发表了《波茨坦宣言》。
description.en: A principal member of the Allied powers in World War II, which co-issued the Potsdam Declaration with the United States and the United Kingdom.

description.zh-cn: 第二次世界大战同盟国主要成员，在战争末期对日宣战并入侵满洲，对日本投降决策产生重要影响。
description.en: A principal member of the Allied powers in World War II, whose declaration of war and invasion of Manchuria in the final days of the war significantly impacted Japan's decision to surrender.

nodes.id: 同盟国 (第二次世界大战)

zh-cn: 同盟国 (第二次世界大战)

description.zh-cn: 在第二次世界大战中与轴心国对立的联盟，要求日本无条件投降。
description.en: The alliance opposing the Axis powers in World War II, which demanded Japan's unconditional surrender.

description.zh-cn: 一场全球性的军事冲突，日本的投降标志着其亚洲战场的结束。
description.en: A global military conflict, the Asian theatre of which concluded with the surrender of Japan.

description.zh-cn: 日本第124代天皇，在战争末期做出接受《波茨坦宣言》、结束战争的最终决定，并通过“玉音放送”向全国宣布投降。
description.en: The 124th Emperor of Japan who made the final decision to accept the Potsdam Declaration and end the war, announcing the surrender to the nation via the Gyokuon-hōsō.

description.zh-cn: 日本投降时的内阁总理大臣，主持了决定接受投降的内阁及御前会议。
description.en: Prime Minister of Japan at the time of surrender, who presided over the cabinet and Imperial conferences that decided to accept surrender.

description.zh-cn: 日本投降时的外务大臣，主和派的核心人物，积极寻求通过苏联调停结束战争。
description.en: Foreign Minister of Japan at the time of surrender, a central figure in the peace faction who actively sought to end the war through Soviet mediation.

description.zh-cn: 日本投降时的陆军大臣，主战派的代表，反对无条件投降，在天皇宣布投降后切腹自杀。
description.en: Army Minister of Japan at the time of surrender, a representative of the war faction who opposed unconditional surrender and committed seppuku after the Emperor's announcement.

description.zh-cn: 时任日本陆军参谋总长，代表日本军方在密苏里号战舰上签署了《降伏文书》。
description.en: Chief of the Imperial Japanese Army General Staff who signed the Instrument of Surrender aboard the USS Missouri on behalf of the Japanese military.

en: Supreme Council for the Direction of the War

description.zh-cn: 日本战时的最高决策机构，由首相、外相、陆相、海相、陆军参谋总长、海军军令部总长组成，在投降问题上存在严重分歧。
description.en: Japan's supreme decision-making body during the war, composed of the Prime Minister, Foreign Minister, Army Minister, Navy Minister, Chief of the Army General Staff, and Chief of the Navy General Staff, which was severely divided on the issue of surrender.

description.zh-cn: 由美、英、中三国发表的对日最后通牒，要求日本无条件投降，否则将面临“迅速且完全的毁灭”。
description.en: An ultimatum issued by the United States, United Kingdom, and China, demanding Japan's unconditional surrender under threat of 'prompt and utter destruction'.

description.zh-cn: 时任美国总统，批准对日本使用原子弹，并接受了日本的投降。
description.en: The President of the United States at the time, who authorized the use of atomic bombs against Japan and accepted its surrender.

description.zh-cn: 时任苏联共产党总书记，在雅尔塔会议上承诺对日作战，其领导的苏联出兵对日本的投降决策造成了重要影响。
description.en: General Secretary of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union who promised at the Yalta Conference to enter the war against Japan; the subsequent Soviet invasion had a major impact on Japan's decision to surrender.

description.zh-cn: 二战末期美、英、苏三国首脑的会议，苏联在此会议上秘密承诺在德国投降后对日作战。
description.en: A meeting of the heads of government of the US, UK, and Soviet Union near the end of WWII, where the USSR secretly committed to entering the war against Japan after Germany's surrender.

description.zh-cn: 美国对日本广岛市投掷原子弹的军事行动，是促使日本投降的关键事件之一。
description.en: The military action by the United States of dropping an atomic bomb on Hiroshima, one of the key events that prompted Japan's surrender.

description.zh-cn: 美国对日本长崎市投掷第二颗原子弹的军事行动，进一步加大了日本投降的压力。
description.en: The military action by the United States of dropping a second atomic bomb on Nagasaki, further increasing pressure on Japan to surrender.

description.zh-cn: 苏联在二战末期对日本展开的军事行动，迅速击溃关东军，与原子弹轰炸共同成为促使日本投降的“双重震撼”。
description.en: A military operation launched by the Soviet Union against Japan at the end of World War II, which swiftly defeated the Kwantung Army and, along with the atomic bombings, created a 'double shock' that led to Japan's surrender.

description.zh-cn: 苏联与日本于1941年签署的中立条约，苏联于1945年8月8日对日宣战时撕毁了该条约。
description.en: A neutrality pact signed between the Soviet Union and Japan in 1941, which the Soviet Union violated when it declared war on Japan on August 8, 1945.

description.zh-cn: 日本于1945年9月2日在东京湾密苏里号战舰上签署的正式投降文件，标志着第二次世界大战的正式结束。
description.en: The formal surrender document signed by Japan aboard the USS Missouri in Tokyo Bay on September 2, 1945, marking the official end of World War II.

description.zh-cn: 由部分日本陆军省军官发动的未遂政变，企图阻止天皇宣布投降，但最终失败。
description.en: An attempted coup d'état by officers of the Japanese Ministry of War to prevent the Emperor from announcing the surrender, which ultimately failed.

description.zh-cn: 日本陆军少佐，策划并领导了旨在阻止日本投降的“宫城事件”，政变失败后自杀。
description.en: A major in the Imperial Japanese Army who planned and led the Kyūjō incident to prevent Japan's surrender; he committed suicide after the coup failed.

description.zh-cn: 时任日本东部军司令官，拒绝参与“宫城事件”，并在平定政变中发挥了关键作用。
description.en: Commander of the Japanese Eastern District Army who refused to participate in the Kyūjō incident and played a key role in suppressing the coup.

description.zh-cn: 美国陆军五星上将，被任命为驻日盟军总司令，代表同盟国接受日本投降并主导了战后对日本的占领。
description.en: A five-star general in the United States Army, appointed as the Supreme Commander for the Allied Powers, who accepted Japan's surrender on behalf of the Allies and led the post-war occupation of Japan.

description.zh-cn: 美国海军战舰，1945年9月2日，日本在此舰上举行了正式的投降仪式。
description.en: A United States Navy battleship aboard which the formal surrender ceremony of Japan was held on September 2, 1945.

en: Imperial Rescript on the Termination of the War

description.zh-cn: 由昭和天皇亲自宣读的诏书，宣布日本接受《波茨坦宣言》并结束战争。其广播被称为“玉音放送”。
description.en: The rescript read by Emperor Shōwa announcing Japan's acceptance of the Potsdam Declaration and the end of the war. Its broadcast is known as the Gyokuon-hōsō.

description.zh-cn: 时任日本外务大臣，代表日本政府在密苏里号战舰上签署了《降伏文书》。
description.en: Foreign Minister of Japan who signed the Instrument of Surrender aboard the USS Missouri on behalf of the Japanese government.

description.zh-cn: 美国在第二次世界大战期间进行的研发首枚原子弹的绝密计划。
description.en: A top-secret research and development undertaking by the United States during World War II that produced the first atomic bombs.

description.zh-cn: 美国在日本广岛市投下第一颗原子弹。
description.en: The United States dropped the first atomic bomb on the Japanese city of Hiroshima.

description.zh-cn: 美国在日本长崎市投下第二颗原子弹。
description.en: The United States dropped the second atomic bomb on the Japanese city of Nagasaki.

description.zh-cn: 苏联对日宣战，并对满洲国发起大规模进攻。
description.en: The Soviet Union declared war on Japan and launched a large-scale offensive against Manchukuo.

description.zh-cn: 苏联违反《苏日中立条约》，向日本宣战。
description.en: The Soviet Union violated the Soviet–Japanese Neutrality Pact by declaring war on Japan.

description.zh-cn: 广岛原子弹爆炸对日本领导层造成巨大冲击，促使其开始认真讨论接受投降的问题。
description.en: The atomic bombing of Hiroshima profoundly shocked Japan's leadership, prompting them to begin seriously discussing the acceptance of surrender.

description.zh-cn: 苏联的入侵打破了日本寻求其调停的希望，与原子弹轰炸共同构成“双重震撼”，迫使日本政府必须立即结束战争。
description.en: The Soviet invasion shattered Japan's hopes for mediation and, along with the atomic bombings, created a 'double shock' that compelled the Japanese government to end the war immediately.

description.zh-cn: 在御前会议上，裕仁天皇做出了接受《波茨坦宣言》条款、结束战争的“圣断”。
description.en: At the Imperial conference (Gozen Kaigi), Emperor Hirohito made the 'sacred decision' (Seidan) to accept the terms of the Potsdam Declaration and end the war.

description.zh-cn: 裕仁天皇亲自录制了《终战诏书》，并于次日向全国广播。
description.en: Emperor Hirohito personally recorded the Imperial Rescript on the Termination of the War, which was broadcast to the nation the following day.

description.zh-cn: 日本代表签署《降伏文书》，标志着第二次世界大战的正式结束。
description.en: The signing of the Instrument of Surrender by Japanese representatives marked the formal end of World War II.

description.zh-cn: 代表日本政府在《降伏文书》上签字。
description.en: Signed the Instrument of Surrender on behalf of the Japanese government.

description.zh-cn: 代表大本营（日本军方）在《降伏文书》上签字。
description.en: Signed the Instrument of Surrender on behalf of the Imperial General Headquarters (the Japanese military).

description.zh-cn: 作为盟军最高统帅，代表同盟国接受日本投降并签署《降伏文书》。
description.en: As Supreme Commander for the Allied Powers, accepted Japan's surrender and signed the Instrument of Surrender on behalf of the Allied Powers.

description.zh-cn: 策划并领导了旨在阻止日本投降的未遂政变。
description.en: Planned and led the attempted coup d'état aimed at preventing Japan's surrender.

description.zh-cn: 政变参与者试图占领皇居，寻找并销毁天皇宣布投降的录音。
description.en: The coup plotters attempted to seize the Imperial Palace to find and destroy the recording of the Emperor's surrender announcement.

description.zh-cn: 作为东部军司令官，拒绝加入政变，并采取行动平定了叛乱。
description.en: As commander of the Eastern District Army, he refused to join the coup and took action to suppress the rebellion.

description.zh-cn: 在天皇宣布投降的广播当天凌晨切腹自杀。
description.en: Committed seppuku on the morning of the day the Emperor's surrender broadcast was to be made.

relationships.source: 同盟国 (第二次世界大战)

description.zh-cn: 在第二次世界大战期间，同盟国与大日本帝国处于战争状态。
description.en: During World War II, the Allied Powers were in a state of war with the Empire of Japan.

relationships.target: 同盟国 (第二次世界大战)

position.en: Supreme Commander for the Allied Powers

description.zh-cn: 被任命为驻日盟军总司令，负责接受日本投降及后续的占领事宜。
description.en: Appointed as the Supreme Commander for the Allied Powers, responsible for accepting Japan's surrender and the subsequent occupation.

description.zh-cn: 曼哈顿计划成功研发了原子弹，使其得以在广岛使用。
description.en: The Manhattan Project successfully developed the atomic bomb, enabling its use on Hiroshima.

description.zh-cn: 在雅尔塔会议上，苏联承诺在德国投降后三个月内对日作战。
description.en: At the Yalta Conference, the Soviet Union committed to entering the war against Japan within three months of Germany's surrender.

description.zh-cn: 在最高战争指导会议上，外务大臣东乡茂德主张接受投降，而陆军大臣阿南惟几则坚决反对，两人立场尖锐对立。
description.en: In the Supreme Council for the Direction of the War, Foreign Minister Shigenori Tōgō advocated for accepting surrender, while Army Minister Korechika Anami staunchly opposed it, representing sharply conflicting positions.
